It does appear that you may have a fungal infection from using the antibiotics.You need to book an appointment to see the doctor as soon as you can.  Get a swab taken from the skin and have it sent to the laboratory for analysis.If it is found that you have a fungus, or the doctor may decide by looking at the skin that it is a fungal problem, he may prescribe oral fungal medications for you to use as well as an antifungal cream or antifungal spray to use as well.  You will also need to have an emollient to use instead of soap.So, don't use any soap, shower or bath gels, they will aggravate the skin more.  Use non perfumed soap, soap that has the same pH level as our skin, baby washes may be fine.  If you can get some Dermol 600 from the pharmacy or the doctor prescribe it for you, this would be a good thing to use in your bath water.  Dermol 600 is an antimicrobial solution that you squirt some into your bath water.Get a big box or tub of Epsom Salts (you can get this on line) and have your bath with 2 or 3 cups full of the salt added to the bath water.  You can still squirt in some Dermol 600.  You will need to put some baby oil or coconut oil into the bath water, because the Epsom Salts is very drying on its own.  What it does, it neutralises the pH level of the skin and the bugs do not like that.As your skin is the way it is at the moment, it will take quite some time for it to heal and get better.  Hygiene is very important as well as doing the above.Wear cotton pants and not nylon and manmade fabrics and no tight trousers.  This is so that your skin can breathe.  Any sweating will make it worse.You may need to be on the antifungal capsules for a few weeks or more before your skin problem clears up as well as using  the lotions and potions.Don't have any sex until you are well again.  When you have sex again and use condoms, use the latex free ones.  Some people get allergies to latex.When you see your doctor, ask him to send you for a fasting glucose test to see if you have glucose intolerance, pre diabetes or diabetes.   It is very common to get lots of these boil things and skin problems in the inner thighs and on the genitals when someone has glucose intolerance, pre diabetes or diabetes.Coconut oil is antibacterial and antifungal and a great moisturiser so you can apply that to your irritated skin - only use the virgin organic oil.  Natural set yogurt will help to reduce any inflammation and itching.Let us know how you get on.Best wishes.
